request.description: Tests if the Authorization Management REST resource is available.
IntraCloud authorization rights consist of a consumer ArrowheadSystem, a provider ArrowheadSystem and an ArrowheadService.

item.name: Get Authorized Services For Provider System

request.description: Returns all the ArrowheadServices from IntraCloud authorization rights where the given System is the provider.

item.name: Get Authorized Services For Consumer System

request.description: Returns all the ArrowheadServices from IntraCloud authorization rights where the given System is the consumer.

item.name: Get IntraCloud Auth Rights For System

request.description: Returns all the IntraCloud authorization rights where the given System is a provider OR consumer.

item.name: Get IntraCloud Auth Rights For Service

request.description: Returns all the IntraCloud authorization rights beloging to the given Service

Multiple provider Systems and Services can be listed at once. For example if there are 3 providers in the list and 4 services, then 12 (3*4) different IntraCloud authorization rights will be saved for the given consumer. AuthenticationInfo should contain the Base64 coded public key of the System, if the System will be used securely with TLS, otherwise it is optional. Only the saved authorization rights are returned. Already existing rules or rules with missing mandatory fields will be skipped.

item.name: Delete IntraCloud Auth Right By ID

request.description: The ID can be acquired with a getAllIntraCloud() request for example. Returns 204 if the request had no effect.

item.name: Delete IntraCloud Auth Rights For Provider System

request.description: Deletes every IntraCloud authorization right where the given System is the provider. Returns 204 if the request had no effect.

item.name: Delete IntraCloud Auth Rights For Consumer System

request.description: Deletes every IntraCloud authorization right where the given System is the consumer. Returns 204 if the request had no effect.
InterCloud authorization rights consist of a consumer ArrowheadCloud and an ArrowheadSerivce. The provider System can be any System registered in the Service Registry with the right Service.
Returns all the Services the Cloud is authorized to consume from this Local Cloud (but the Services might not be available).

item.name: Get InterCloud Auth Rights For Cloud
Get InterCloud Auth Rights For Service

request.description: Returns all the InterCloud authorization rights with the given Service.

Multiple Services can be listed at once, adding a new InterCloud authorization right for each Cloud-Service pair. Only the saved authorization rights are returned. Already existing rules or rules with missing mandatory fields will be skipped.

item.name: Delete InterCloud Auth Right By ID

request.description: The ID can be acquired with a getAllInterCloud() request for example. Returns 204 if the request had no effect.

item.name: Delete InterCloud Auth Rights For Cloud

request.description: Returns 204 if the request had no effect.
Tests if the Authorization REST resource is available.
Multiple providers can be given, the response will be a HashMap<ProviderSystem, boolean>
Returns true or false

The token is generated from the RawTokenInfo POJO for each Provider, which includes the first interface of each Service. Token generation is skipped for a Provider, if its authentication info does not hold a valid Base64 coded (RSA 2048-bit) public key.
Tests if the Gatekeeper Management REST resource is available.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

request.description: The Gatekeeper will turn to these Clouds during a Global Service Discovery, if none were given by the Consumer System.
The Cloud is identified by the path parameters: operator and cloud name.
Only the saved neighboring clouds are returned. Already existing clouds or clouds with missing mandatory fields will be skipped.

Updates an existing Neighboring Cloud identifed by the cloud name and operator fields (this 2 fields together has to be unique). If the cloud name or operator field needs to be changed, delete the Neighboring Cloud first and post the new one with the modified fields.
Neighboring Cloud is identified by the operator and cloud name path parameters.
Brokers handle the communication between the Gateway core systems, usually using AMQP or MQTT protocol.
The Broker is identified by the broker name path parameter.
The Brokers are identified by the address path parameter.

item.name: Get Brokers By Address And Port

request.description: Only the saved brokers are returned. Already existing brokers or brokers with missing mandatory fields (name, address, port) will be skipped
Use delete+save request if you wish to change the broker name (it is used as an ID). Other fields can be changed with this request.

This is the "provider side" of the Global Service Discovery process, where the receiver Gatekeeper will check if the requester Cloud is authorized to consume the requested Service AND it can be found in the local Service Registry at the moment.
This is the "consumer side" of the Global Service Discovery process, where the local Gatekeeper will receive this request from the local Orchestrator to start the GSD process with the given Clouds
This REST resource providers CRUD methods to ArrowheadSystems, ArrowheadServices and ArrowheadClouds.
Save Services

item.name: Get Cloud By Operator And Name

body.raw:
{
  "operator": "test_operator",
  "cloudName": "test_cloud",
  "address": "updated address",
  "port": 8080,
  "gatekeeperServiceURI": "updated service uri",
  "authenticationInfo": "updated auth info",
  "secure": false
}

item.name: Query Store w/ Consumer And Service

request.description: Store entry where the flag should be flipped is identified by the ID pathparameter.
To update the service, consumer, providerSystem or providerClouds fields too, use the Common API resources.

item.name: Delete Store Entry By Consumer Name
Get Default Store Entries For Consumer
Get Store Entries For Given Consumer/Service Pair

request.description: This REST resource can only be used in secure mode, where the client certificate Common Name containts the Consumer System Name, which identifies the store entries.

item.name: Get Store Entries For Consumer/Service Pair (TLS)

request.description: This REST resource can only be used in secure mode, where the client certificate Common Name containts the Consumer System Name, which (along with the Service Definition path parameter) identifies the store entries .

item.name: Get Store Orchestration Process For Given System
Get Service Registry Entry By Provider Name
Get Service Registry Entry By Service Name
